<P align="center" style="page-break-before:always; margin:0pt;  line-height:10pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt; color:#3F3F3F"></P>

<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><B>Additional information</B></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><B><BR></B></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>In addition to the information set forth below, we draw your attention to the press release we furnished to the Securities and Exchange Commission on Form 6-K on September 3, 2009.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><B><BR></B></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><B>Operating and Financial Review and Prospects as of and for the Period Ended June 30, 2009.</B></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><B><I>Forward-looking Information</I></B></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><B><I><BR></I></B></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>This discussion of our Operational and Financial Review and Prospects contains forward-looking statements based on beliefs of our management. We use the words &#147;anticipate,&#148; &#147;believe,&#148; &#147;expect,&#148; &#147;may,&#148; &#147;intend,&#148; &#147;should,&#148; &#147;plan,&#148; &#147;project,&#148; or similar expressions to identify forward-looking statements. Such statements reflect our current views with respect to future events and are subject to risks and uncertainties. Many factors could cause the actual results to be materially different, including, among others, changes in general economic and business conditions, changes in currency exchange rates and interest rates, introduction of competing products, lack of acceptance of new products or services and changes in business strategy. Such forward-looking statements include, but are not limited to, the forecasts and targets included in this discussion under the heading &#147;Oper
ating and Financial Review and Prospects as of and for the Period Ended June 30, 2009 &#151; Overall Perspective,&#148; with respect to (i) our expectation that the global telecommunications equipment and related services market will decline between 8% and 12% at constant currencies in 2009, (ii) our expectation that we will reduce costs and expenses, excluding the negative non-cash impacts of Lucent&#8217;s purchase price allocation, by &#8364; 750 million on an exit run rate by the fourth quarter of 2009 as compared with the fourth quarter of 2008, and (iii) our expectation that we will achieve income from operating activities before restructuring costs, impairment of assets, gain/(loss) on disposal of consolidated entities and post-retirement benefit plan amendment (excluding the negative, non-cash impacts of Lucent&#146;s purchase price allocation) around break-even in full year 2009, (iv) our estimate that the actions we are taking to offset a potential unfavorable shift in our product and geographic mi
x should generate annual savings of &#8364;250 million (as part of the reduction of costs and expenses of &#8364; 750 million mentioned above) and our view that the increase of the U.S. dollar versus the euro in the first half of 2009 had a negative impact on our gross profit as a percentage of revenue, included in this discussion under the heading &#147;Consolidated Results of Operations for the Six Months Ended June 30, 2009 compared to the Six Months Ended June 30, 2008 &#150; Gross Profit&#148;, and (v) the amount we would be required to pay in the future pursuant to our existing contractual obligations and off-balance sheet contingent commitments, included in this discussion under the heading &#147;Contractual obligations and off-balance sheet contingent commitments&#148;.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><B><I><BR></I></B></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><B><I>Presentation of Financial Information</I></B></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify> <BR>
</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>The following discussion of our financial condition and results of operations should be read in conjunction with our unaudited condensed interim consolidated financial statements as of and for the six-month period ended June 30, 2009 presented elsewhere in this document (the &#147;unaudited condensed interim consolidated financial statements&#148;) and the related notes. Our unaudited condensed interim consolidated financial statements have been prepared in accordance with International Financial Reporting Standards (&#147;IFRS&#148;) as adopted by the European Union. IFRS, as adopted by the European Union, differ in certain respects from the International Financial Reporting Standards issued by the International Accounting Standards Board. However, our unaudited condensed interim consolidated financial statements presented in accordance with IFRS would be no different if we had applied International Financial Reporting Standards issued by the Internatio
nal Accounting Standards Board. References to &#147;IFRS&#148; in this Form 6-K refer to IFRS as adopted by the European Union.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>On November 30, 2006, historical Alcatel and Lucent Technologies Inc. (&quot;Lucent&quot;) completed a business combination pursuant to which Lucent became a wholly owned subsidiary of Alcatel. As a result of the purchase accounting treatment of the Lucent business combination required by IFRS, our results for 2007, 2008 and the first half of 2009 included several negative, non-cash impacts of purchase accounting entries.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><B>Changes in Accounting Standards as of January 1, 2009</B></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><B><BR></B></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><I><U>New financial reporting standards and interpretations that the Group applies but which are not yet mandatory</U></I></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>As of June 30,&nbsp;2009, Alcatel-Lucent had not applied any new International Financial Reporting Standards and Interpretations that the European Union has published and adopted but which were not yet mandatory.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><I><U>New financial reporting standards or amendments applied as of January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2009</U></I></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><I>IAS 1 &#150;Presentation of Financial Statements - revised </I></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>The IASB published amendments to IAS 1 &#147;Presentation of Financial Statements: A Revised Presentation&#148; during 2007, which were endorsed by the European Union and became effective as of January 1, 2009.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>The main changes from the previous version of IAS 1 are as follows:</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:36pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align=justify>-</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:36pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial">the titles &#147;balance sheet&#148; and &#147;cash flow statement&#148; are now denominated &#147;statement of financial position&#148; and &#147;statement of cash flows&#148;;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:36pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=center>p. 1</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Trebuchet MS" align=justify><BR></P>
<HR style="padding-top:7.2pt; padding-bottom:7.2pt" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="page-break-before:always; margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:36pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align=justify>-</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:36pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial">all changes arising from transactions with owners in their capacity as owners be presented separately from non-owner changes in equity;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:36pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align=justify>-</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:36pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial">income and expenses be presented in one statement (statement of comprehensive income) or two statements (a separate income statement and a statement of comprehensive income);</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:36pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align=justify>-</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:36pt; font-family:Times New Roman" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial">the total comprehensive income be presented in the financial statements.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><B>Critical accounting policies</B></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><B><BR></B></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Our Operating and Financial Review and Prospects is based on our unaudited condensed interim consolidated financial statements, which are prepared in accordance with IFRS as described in Note 1 to those unaudited condensed interim consolidated financial statements. Some of the accounting methods and policies used in preparing our unaudited condensed interim consolidated financial statements under IFRS are based on complex and subjective assessments by our management or on estimates based on past experience and assumptions deemed realistic and reasonable based on the circumstances concerned. The actual value of our assets, liabilities and shareholders&#146; equity and of our earnings could differ from the value derived from these estimates if conditions changed and these changes had an impact on the assumptions adopted.</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>We believe that the accounting methods and policies listed below are the most likely to be affected by these estimates and assessments:</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:12.75pt; text-indent:-12.75pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><I><U>Valuation allowance for inventories and work in progress</U></I></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Inventories and work in progress are measured at the lower of cost or net realizable value. Valuation allowances for inventories and work in progress are calculated based on an analysis of foreseeable changes in demand, technology or the market, in order to determine obsolete or excess inventories and work in progress.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>The valuation allowances are accounted for in cost of sales or in restructuring costs depending on the nature of the amounts concerned. </P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<TABLE style="font-size:10pt" cellspacing=0 align=center><TR><TD style="background-color:#FFFFFF; border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=top width=383.467><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>(In millions of euros)</P></TD><TD style="background-color:#FFFFFF; border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=top width=300.8 colspan=2>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:12.75pt; text-indent:-12.75pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><I><U>Impairment of customer receivables</U></I></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>An impairment loss is recorded for customer receivables if the present value of the future receipts is below the nominal value. The amount of the impairment loss reflects both the customers&#146; ability to honor their debts and the age of the debts in question. A higher default rate than estimated or the deterioration of Alcatel-Lucent major customers&#146; creditworthiness could have an adverse impact on Alcatel-Lucent future results.</P>
<TABLE style="font-size:10pt" cellspacing=0 align=center><TR><TD style="background-color:#FFFFFF; border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=top width=383.6><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>(In millions of euros)</P></TD><TD style="background-color:#FFFFFF; border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=top width=300.667 colspan=2><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>&nbsp;</P>

<TR><TD style="border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=bottom width=383.6><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Impact of impairment losses in income (loss) before income tax, related reduction of goodwill and discontinued operations</P>
</TD><TD style="border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=bottom width=151.933><P style="margin:0pt; padding-right:2.55pt; font-family:Arial" align=center>(17)</P>
</TD><TD style="border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=bottom width=148.733><P style="margin:0pt; padding-right:2.55pt; font-family:Arial" align=center>(17)</P>
</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:12.75pt; text-indent:-12.75pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><I><U>Capitalized development costs, other intangible assets and goodwill</U></I></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><I>Capitalized development costs </I></P>
<TABLE style="font-size:10pt" cellspacing=0 align=center><TR><TD style="background-color:#FFFFFF; border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=top width=370.867><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>(In millions of euros)</P></TD><TD style="background-color:#FFFFFF; border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=top width=313.4 colspan=2><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>&nbsp;</P>
</TD></TR>
<TR><TD style="background-color:#ECECEC; border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=top width=370.867>&nbsp;</TD><TD style="background-color:#ECECEC; border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=bottom width=160.4><P style="margin:0pt; padding-right:2.55pt; font-family:Arial" align=center><B>June 30, 2009</B></P>
</TD><TD style="background-color:#ECECEC; border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=bottom width=153><P style="margin:0pt; padding-right:2.55pt; font-family:Arial" align=center><B>December 31, 2008</B></P>
</TD></TR>
<TR><TD style="border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" width=370.867><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Capitalized development costs, net</P>
</TD><TD style="border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=bottom width=160.4><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=center>560</P>
</TD><TD style="border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=top width=153><P style="margin:0pt; padding-right:2.55pt; font-family:Arial" align=center>578</P>
</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>The criteria for capitalizing development costs are set out in note 1f. Once capitalized, these costs are amortized over the estimated lives of the products concerned (3 to 10 years).</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>The Group must therefore evaluate the commercial and technical feasibility of these development projects and estimate the useful lives of the products resulting from the projects. Should a product fail to substantiate these assumptions, the Group may be required to impair or write off some of the capitalized development costs in the future.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=center>p. 2</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Trebuchet MS" align=justify><BR></P>
<HR style="padding-top:7.2pt; padding-bottom:7.2pt" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="page-break-before:always; margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>An impairment loss of &#8364; 16 million on capitalized development costs has been accounted for during the first six months of 2009. </P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Impairment losses for capitalized development costs of &#8364;&nbsp;135 million were accounted for in the fourth quarter of 2008 mainly related to a change in our WiMAX strategy, by focusing on supporting fixed and nomadic broadband access applications for providers. This impairment is presented on the specific line item &#147;Impairment of assets&#148; in the income statement.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>No impairment loss was accounted for during the first six months of 2008.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><I>Other intangible assets and goodwill</I></P>
<TABLE style="font-size:10pt" cellspacing=0 align=center><TR><TD style="background-color:#FFFFFF; border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=top width=332.8><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>(In millions of euros)</P></TD><TD style="background-color:#FFFFFF; border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=top width=351.467 colspan=2><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>&nbsp;</P>
</TD></TR>
<TR><TD style="background-color:#ECECEC; border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=top width=332.8>&nbsp;</TD><TD style="background-color:#ECECEC; border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=bottom width=175.733><P style="margin:0pt; padding-right:2.55pt; font-family:Arial" align=center><B>June 30, 2009</B></P>
</TD><TD style="background-color:#ECECEC; border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=bottom width=175.733><P style="margin:0pt; padding-right:2.55pt; font-family:Arial" align=center><B>December 31, 2008</B></P>
</TD></TR>
<TR><TD width=332.8><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Goodwill, net</P>
</TD><TD width=175.733><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=center>4,202</P>
</TD><TD valign=top width=175.733><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=center>4,215</P>
</TD></TR>
<TR><TD style="border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" width=332.8><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Intangible assets, net <SUP>(1)</SUP></P>
</TD><TD style="border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" width=175.733><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=center>2,385</P>
</TD><TD style="border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=top width=175.733><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=center>2,567</P>
</TD></TR>
<TR><TD style="background-color:#ECECEC; border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" width=332.8><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><B>Total</B></P>
</TD><TD style="background-color:#ECECEC; border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" width=175.733><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=center><B>6,587</B></P>
</TD><TD style="background-color:#ECECEC; border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=top width=175.733><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=center><B>6,782</B></P>
</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P style="margin-top:2.5pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>(1) Including capitalized development costs.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Goodwill amounting to &#8364;&nbsp;8,051 million and intangible assets amounting to &#8364;&nbsp;4,813 million were accounted for in 2006 as a result of the Lucent business combination, using market-related information, estimates (primarily based on risk adjusted discounted cash flows derived from Lucent&#8217;s management) and judgment (in particular in determining the fair values relating to the intangible assets acquired).</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>No impairment loss was accounted for during the first six months of 2009.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Impairment losses of &#8364;&nbsp;4,545 million were accounted for in 2008 (of which an impairment loss of &#8364; 810 million, related to CDMA was accounted for as of June 30, 2008) mainly related to the CDMA (&#8364;&nbsp;2,533 million), Optics (&#8364;&nbsp;1,019 million), Multicore (&#8364;&nbsp;300 million) and Applications (&#8364;&nbsp;339&nbsp;million) business divisions, which are considered to be our groups of Cash Generating Units (&#8220;CGU&#8221;) at which impairment tests of goodwill are performed.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>The recoverable value of each business division is calculated based upon a five year discounted cash flow approach plus a discounted residual value, corresponding to the weighted average of the following three approaches:</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:21.3pt; text-indent:-21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify>&#183;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial">capitalization to perpetuity of the normalized cash flows of year 5 (Gordon Shapiro approach) &#8211; weighted 50%,</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:21.3pt; text-indent:-21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify>&#183;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial">application of a Sales Multiple (Enterprise Value-&#8220;EV&#8221;/Sales) &#8211; weighted 25%,</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:21.3pt; text-indent:-21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify>&#183;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial">application of an Operating Profit Multiple (Enterprise Value-&#8220;EV&#8221;/Earning Before Interest, Tax, Depreciation and Amortization-&#8220;EBITDA&#8221;) &#8211;weighted 25%.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>The recoverable values of our goodwill and intangible assets, as determined for the 2009 annual impairment test performed by the Group in the second quarter 2009, are based on key assumptions which could have a significant impact on the interim consolidated financial statements. These key assumptions include among others the following elements:</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:42.55pt; text-indent:-7.1pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>- discount rate; and</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:42.55pt; text-indent:-7.1pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>- projected cash-flows arising out of the successful implementation of the strategic plan the Group publicly announced on December 12, 2008 and on a nominal rate of growth of our revenues in 2010.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>The discount rate used for the annual impairment tests of 2009 and 2008 was the Group&#146;s weighted average cost of capital (&#147;WACC&#148;) of 11% and 10% respectively. For the additional impairment test performed during the fourth quarter 2008, the rate used was 12%. These discount rates are after-tax rates applied to after-tax cash flows. The use of such rates results in recoverable values that are identical to those that would be obtained by using, as required by IAS 36, pre-tax rates applied to pre-tax cash flows. Given the absence of comparable &#147;pure player&#148; listed companies for each group of Cash Generating Units, we do not believe that the assessment of a specific WACC for each product or market is feasible. A single discount rate has therefore been used on the basis that risks specific to certain products or markets have been reflected in determining the cash flows. </P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Holding all other assumptions constant, a 0.5% increase or decrease in the discount rate would have decreased or increased the 2009 recoverable values of goodwill and intangible assets by &#8364; 373 million and &#8364; 406 million, respectively. An increase of 0.5% in the discount rate would not have impacted impairment losses as of June 30, 2009.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>As indicated in note 1g, in addition to the annual goodwill impairment tests, impairment tests are carried out if Alcatel-Lucent has indications of a potential reduction in the value of its goodwill or intangible assets. Possible impairments are based on discounted future cash flows and/or fair values of the assets concerned. Changes in the market conditions or the cash flows initially estimated can therefore lead to a review and a change in the impairment losses previously recorded.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=center>p. 3</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<HR style="padding-top:7.2pt; padding-bottom:7.2pt" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="page-break-before:always; margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:12.75pt; text-indent:-12.75pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><I><U>Impairment of property, plant and equipment</U></I></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>In accordance with IAS 36 &#147;Impairment of Assets&#148;, when events or changes in market conditions indicate that tangible or intangible assets may be impaired, such assets are reviewed in detail to determine whether their carrying value is lower than their recoverable value, which could lead to recording an impairment loss (recoverable value is the higher of value in use and fair value less costs to sell) (see note 1g). Value in use is estimated by calculating the present value of the future cash flows expected to be derived from the asset. Fair value less costs to sell is based on the most reliable information available (market statistics, recent transactions, etc.).</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>When determining recoverable values of property, plant and equipment, assumptions and estimates are made, based primarily on market outlooks, obsolescence and sale or liquidation disposal values. Any change in these assumptions can have a significant effect on the recoverable amount and could lead to a revision of recorded impairment losses.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>No impairment loss on property, plant and equipment was accounted for during the first six months of 2009.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>The planned closing of certain facilities, additional reductions in personnel and unfavorable market conditions have been considered impairment triggering events in prior years. Impairment losses of &#8364;&nbsp;34 million were recorded on property, plant and equipment in 2008.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:12.75pt; text-indent:-12.75pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><I><U>Provision for warranty costs and other product sales reserves</U></I></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Provisions are recorded for (i) warranties given to customers on Alcatel-Lucent products, (ii) expected losses at completion and (iii) penalties incurred in the event of failure to meet contractual obligations. These provisions are calculated based on historical return rates and warranty costs expensed as well as on estimates. These provisions and subsequent changes to the provisions are recorded in cost of sales either when revenue is recognized (provision for customer warranties) or, for construction contracts, when revenue and expenses are recognized by reference to the stage of completion of the contract activity. Costs and penalties ultimately paid can differ considerably from the amounts initially reserved and could therefore have a significant impact on future results.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<TABLE style="font-size:10pt" cellspacing=0 align=center><TR><TD style="background-color:#FFFFFF; border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=top width=380><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>(In millions of euros)</P></TD><TD style="background-color:#FFFFFF; border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=top width=304.267 colspan=2><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>&nbsp;</P>

<P style="margin-top:2.5pt; margin-bottom:0pt; padding-left:21.25pt; text-indent:-21.25pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>(1) See note 13, included in the amounts due to/from customers on construction contracts</P>

<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>For further information on the impact on the income statement of changes in these provisions, see notes 13 and 16.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:12.75pt; text-indent:-12.75pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><I><U>Deferred taxes</U></I></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Deferred tax assets relate primarily to tax loss carry-forwards and to deductible temporary differences between reported amounts and the tax bases of assets and liabilities. The assets relating to the tax loss carry-forwards are recognized if it is probable that the Group will generate future taxable profits against which these tax losses can be set off.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=center>p. 4</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<HR style="padding-top:7.2pt; padding-bottom:7.2pt" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="page-break-before:always; margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<TABLE style="font-size:10pt" cellspacing=0 align=center><TR><TD style="background-color:#FFFFFF; border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=top width=360><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>(In millions of euros)</P></TD><TD style="background-color:#FFFFFF; border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=top width=324.267 colspan=3><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>&nbsp;</P>

</TD><TD valign=bottom width=149><P style="margin:0pt; padding-right:2.55pt; font-family:Arial" align=center>182 <SUP>(1)</SUP></P>

</TD><TD style="background-color:#ECECEC; border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=top width=158.6><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=center><B>852</B></P>
