</TABLE>
<P style="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; padding-bottom:3pt; line-height:14pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:12pt; border-bottom:2.25pt solid #000000" align=justify><B>Note 5 Share-based payments (stock option plans)</B></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><B><I>Impact on income (loss) from operating activities of share-based payments resulting from stock options, stock purchase plans and restricted stocks units and restricted cash units </I></B></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><B><I><BR></I></B></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Compensation expense recognized for share-based payments in accordance with IFRS 2 is analyzed as follows:</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<TABLE style="font-size:10pt" cellspacing=0 align=center><TR><TD style="border-bottom:0.75pt solid #000000" valign=bottom width=401.333>&nbsp;</TD><TD style="border-bottom:0.75pt solid #000000" valign=bottom width=282.933 colspan=2><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=right>(In millions of euros)</P>
</TD></TR>
<TR><TD style="background-color:#ECECEC; border-bottom:0.75pt solid #000000" valign=bottom width=401.333>&nbsp;</TD><TD style="background-color:#ECECEC; border-bottom:0.75pt solid #000000" valign=bottom width=144.133><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=right><B>Six months &nbsp;ended June&nbsp;30,</B>&nbsp;<B> 2009</B></P>
</TD><TD style="background-color:#ECECEC; border-bottom:0.75pt solid #000000" valign=bottom width=138.8><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=right><B>Six months &nbsp;ended June&nbsp;30,</B>&nbsp;<B> 2008</B></P>
</TD></TR>
<TR><TD style="border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=top width=401.333><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial">Compensation expense for share-based payments</P>
</TD><TD style="border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=bottom width=144.133><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=right>32</P>
</TD><TD style="border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=bottom width=138.8><P style="margin:0pt; padding-right:3.65pt; font-family:Arial" align=right>49</P>
</TD></TR>
<TR><TD valign=top width=401.333><P style="margin:0pt; line-height:11pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:9pt" align=justify><I>Presented in the income statement:</I></P>
</TD><TD valign=bottom width=144.133>&nbsp;</TD><TD valign=bottom width=138.8>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
<TR><TD valign=top width=401.333><P style="margin:0pt; line-height:11pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:9pt" align=justify><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- cost of sales </I></P>
</TD><TD valign=bottom width=144.133><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=right><I>9</I></P>
</TD><TD valign=bottom width=138.8><P style="margin:0pt; padding-right:3.65pt; line-height:11pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:9pt" align=right><I>12</I></P>
</TD></TR>
<TR><TD valign=top width=401.333><P style="margin:0pt; line-height:11pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:9pt" align=justify><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- administrative and selling expenses</I></P>
</TD><TD valign=bottom width=144.133><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=right><I>15</I></P>
</TD><TD valign=bottom width=138.8><P style="margin:0pt; padding-right:3.65pt; line-height:11pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:9pt" align=right><I>22</I></P>
</TD></TR>
<TR><TD valign=top width=401.333><P style="margin:0pt; line-height:11pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:9pt" align=justify><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- research and development costs</I></P>
</TD><TD valign=bottom width=144.133><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=right><I>9</I></P>
</TD><TD valign=bottom width=138.8><P style="margin:0pt; padding-right:3.65pt; line-height:11pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:9pt" align=right><I>13</I></P>
</TD></TR>
<TR><TD style="border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=top width=401.333><P style="margin:0pt; line-height:11pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:9pt" align=justify><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;- restructuring costs</I></P>
</TD><TD style="border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=bottom width=144.133><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=right><I>(1)</I></P>
</TD><TD style="border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=bottom width=138.8><P style="margin:0pt; padding-right:3.65pt; line-height:11pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:9pt" align=right><I>2</I></P>
</TD></TR>
<TR><TD valign=top width=401.333><P style="margin:0pt; line-height:11pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:9pt" align=justify><I>Of which equity settled</I></P>
</TD><TD valign=bottom width=144.133><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=right><I>32</I></P>
</TD><TD valign=bottom width=138.8><P style="margin:0pt; padding-right:3.65pt; line-height:11pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:9pt" align=right><I>47</I></P>
</TD></TR>
<TR><TD style="border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=top width=401.333><P style="margin:0pt; line-height:11pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:9pt" align=justify><I>Of which cash settled</I></P>
</TD><TD style="border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=bottom width=144.133><P style="margin:0pt; padding-right:3.65pt; font-family:Arial" align=right><I>0</I></P>
</TD><TD style="border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=bottom width=138.8><P style="margin:0pt; padding-right:3.65pt; line-height:11pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:9pt" align=right><I>2</I></P>
</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Only share-based payment plans established after November&nbsp;7,&nbsp;2002, and whose share-based payments that were not yet fully vested at January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2005, are restated according to IFRS 2 &#147;Share-based Payment&#148;. Those share-based payments that were fully vested at December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2004 did not result in a charge due to the adoption of IFRSs in subsequent accounting periods.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>By simplification, for historical Alcatel plans, during the vesting period and as a result of employees leaving the Group, no share-based payment forfeitures are taken into account when determining compensation expense for share-based payments granted. During the vesting period and as a result of employees leaving the Group, the accounting impact of share-based payment forfeiture is recognized when the forfeiture occurs. For share-based payments cancelled by forfeiture before the end of the vesting period, this can mean correcting the charge, recognized in prior accounting periods, in the period following the forfeiture.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>During the vesting period, estimated annual forfeiture rates of 7% for Lucent plans and 5% for share-based payments granted by Alcatel-Lucent since March 2007 are applied when determining compensation expense. The estimated forfeiture rate is ultimately adjusted to actual.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Share-based payments cancelled after the vesting period and share-based payments not exercised do not result in correcting charges previously recognized.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><B><I>Stock options</I></B></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>

<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><B><I>Fair value of options granted by historical Alcatel (prior to December&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2006) and by Alcatel-Lucent (after December&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2006)</I></B></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>The fair value of stock options is measured at grant date using the Cox-Ross-Rubinstein binomial model. This allows behavioral factors governing the exercise of stock options to be taken into consideration and to consider that all options will not be systematically exercised by the end of the exercise period. The expected volatility is determined as being the implied volatility at the grant date.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=center>F29</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<HR style="padding-top:7.2pt; padding-bottom:7.2pt" noshade size=1.333>


<P style="page-break-before:always; margin-top:0pt;  padding-left:21.3pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Assumptions for the plans representing more than 1,000,000 outstanding options related to historical Alcatel (before December&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2006) and Alcatel-Lucent (after December&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2006) are as follows:</P>



<P style=" margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:21.3pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify>&#183;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial">expected volatility: 40% for the March 2005 plan, 32% for the March 2006 plan, 33% for the March 2007 plan, 45% for the March 2008 plan and 64% for the March 2009 plans;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:21.3pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify>&#183;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial">risk-free rate: 3.50% for the March 2005 plan and March 2006 plan, 4% for the March 2007 plan, 3.90% for the March 2008 Plan and 3.00% for the March 2009 plans;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:21.3pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify>&#183;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial">distribution rate on future income: 0% in 2005, 1%&nbsp;for March 2006 plan and 0.8% for later years.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Based on these assumptions, the fair values of historical Alcatel options (before December&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2006) and Alcatel-Lucent options (after December&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2006) used in the calculation of compensation expense for share-based payments are as follows:</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:21.3pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify>&#183;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial">March 2005 plan with an exercise price of &#8364;&nbsp;10.00: fair value of &#8364;&nbsp;3.72;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:21.3pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify>&#183;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial">March 2006 plan with an exercise price of &#8364;&nbsp;11.70: fair value of &#8364;&nbsp;3.77;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:21.3pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify>&#183;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial">March 2007 plan with an exercise price of &#8364;&nbsp;9.10: fair value of &#8364;&nbsp;3.04;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:21.3pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify>&#183;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial">March 2008 plan with an exercise price of &#8364;&nbsp;3.80: fair value of &#8364;&nbsp;1.50;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:21.3pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify>&#183;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial">March 2009 plan with an exercise price of &#8364;&nbsp;2.00: fair value of &#8364;&nbsp;0.49;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:21.3pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify>&#183;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial">March 2009 all employees plan with an exercise price of &#8364;&nbsp;2.00: fair value of &#8364;&nbsp;0.46;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:21.3pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify>&#183;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial">Other plans have fair values between &#8364;&nbsp;0.69 and &#8364;&nbsp;4.18 and a weighted average fair value of &#8364;&nbsp;2.06.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><B><I>Lucent stock-based awards:</I></B></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>The fair values were recalculated at November 30, 2006, the business combination date, with the following assumptions:</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:21.3pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify>&#183;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial">expected volatility: 26.20% to 32.37% depending on the remaining life of the options;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:21.3pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify>&#183;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial">risk-free rate: 3.35% to 3.62% depending on the remaining life of the options;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:21.3pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify>&#183;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial">distribution rate on future income: 0.8%.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>The estimated fair value of outstanding stock awards as of November 30, 2006 was &#8364;&nbsp;133 million, consisting of &#8364;&nbsp;96 million for vested options and &#8364;&nbsp;37 million for unvested options. </P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>

<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><B><I>Characteristics of stock option plans or stock purchase plans recognized in compliance with IFRS&nbsp;2</I></B></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><I><U>Vesting conditions:</U></I></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>The following rules are applicable to all plans granted by historical Alcatel in 2005 and 2006 and by Alcatel-Lucent in 2007, 2008 and 2009 except for the March 2009 all employees plan and for options granted after May 2008 to Management Committee members:</P>

<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>

<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:21.3pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify>&#183;</P>

<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial">Vesting is gradual: options vest in successive portions over 4 years, for which 25% of the options are vested if the employee remains employed after 12 months and, for each month after the first year, 1/48 of the options are vested if the employee remains employed by the Group; </FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:21.3pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify>&#183;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial">Exercise period depends on country: in some countries, stock options can be exercised as soon as they vest; in other countries, stock options cannot be exercised during a four-year vesting period. Whatever the beginning of the exercise period is, stock options terminate 8 years after the grant date.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><I><U>Vesting conditions for the March 2009 all employees plan:</U></I></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>On March 18, 2009, our Board of Directors authorized the grant of 400 stock options to all of our employees, subject to compliance with the relevant laws of the countries where the beneficiaries work. The following rules are applicable:</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:21.3pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify>&#183;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial">These options will vest, subject to the service conditions, in two successive tranches, at 50% per year over two years; </FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:21.3pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify>&#183;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial">Exercise period depends on country: in some countries, stock options can be exercised as soon as they vest; in other countries, stock options cannot be exercised during a four-year vesting period. Whatever the beginning of the <a name="_Toc234744482"></a>exercise period is, stock options terminate 8 years after the grant date.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>









<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=center>F30</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<HR style="padding-top:7.2pt; padding-bottom:7.2pt" noshade size=1.333>



<P style="page-break-before:always; margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><I><U>Vesting conditions for options granted after May 2008 to Management Committee members:</U></I></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>The following rules are applicable to all options granted after May 2008 by Alcatel-Lucent to Management Committee members:</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:21.3pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify>&#183;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial">Vesting is gradual: options vest linearly over 4 years (25% per year); </FONT></P>








<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:21.3pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify>&#183;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial">Exercise period depends on country: in some countries, stock options can be exercised as soon as they vest; in other countries, stock options cannot be exercised during a four-year vesting period. Whatever the beginning of the exercise period is, stock options terminate 8 years after the grant date.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:21.3pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify>&#183;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial">Performance conditions for option grants applicable to members of our Management Committee: Options granted to members of our Management Committee are subject to the same conditions as those governing all other beneficiaries. In addition, &nbsp;in compliance with the commitment made by our Board of Directors at the Annual Shareholders&#146; Meeting held on May 30, 2008, 50% of the options granted after this date to Management Committee members are also subject to an additional exercisability condition linked to the performance of Alcatel-Lucent shares. The share price of Alcatel-Lucent shares will be measured yearly in relation to a representative sample of 14 peer group companies that are solution and service providers in the telecommunications equipment sector (this figure may be revised in line with market changes). The number of vested stock options that will be exercisable will be measured annually in proport
ion to our stock price&#146;s performance as compared to our peer group. This annual measurement will occur over a four-year period, beginning from the grant date. At the Board meeting closest to the end of each twelve month period, our Board, after consultation with the Compensation Committee, will determine whether or not the stock performance target has been met for the prior year, based on an annual study conducted by a third party consulting firm.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Certain plans that existed at companies acquired in business combinations were converted into historical Alcatel or Alcatel-Lucent subscription stock option plans or stock purchase plans. For plans of companies acquired, the vesting conditions and the option lives of the original plans remain in place.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>For former Lucent stock options, vesting rules remain unchanged. Stock options usually vest linearly over a 4-year period (25% per year) and can be exercised as soon as they vest.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><I><U>Conditions of settlement:</U></I></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>All stock options granted by historical Alcatel, Lucent (prior to the business combination) or Alcatel-Lucent are exclusively settled in shares.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=center>F31</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<HR style="padding-top:7.2pt; padding-bottom:7.2pt" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="page-break-before:always; margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><I><U>Number of options granted and changes in number of options </U></I></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Stock option plans covered by IFRS 2 (excluding all Lucent plans) and the change in number of stock options generating compensation expense are:</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>

<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><B><I>Restricted Cash Units (RCUs)</I></B></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>The Board decided at its meeting held on April&nbsp;4,&nbsp;2008 to award up to 366,300 Restricted Cash Units (RCUs) to Patricia Russo if certain criteria were met over the two-year period following the Board&#146;s decision. They were cancelled when Patricia Russo left the Group. These restricted cash units had therefore no impact on the net result for the six months ended June 30, 2009.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><B><I>Restricted Stock Units (RSUs) or Performance shares</I></B></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><I><U>Fair value of Performance shares granted by Alcatel-Lucent</U></I></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>The fair value of performance shares is measured at grant date as being the Alcatel-Lucent share price discounted by the assumed distribution rate on future income, set at 0.8% per year.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Based on this assumption, the fair values of Alcatel-Lucent performance shares used in the calculation of compensation expense for share-based payments are as follows:</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:21.3pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify>&#183;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial">September 17, 2008 plan: fair value of &#8364;&nbsp;3.05;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:21.3pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify>&#183;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial">October 29, 2008 plan: fair value of &#8364;&nbsp;1.63;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:21.3pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify>&#183;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial">March 2009 plan: fair value of &#8364;&nbsp;1.19;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>

<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><I><U>Vesting conditions:</U></I></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>The following rules are applicable to all performance share plans granted by Alcatel-Lucent:</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:21.3pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify>&#183;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial">Service condition: For a beneficiary who is an employee and/or Executive Officer of a company within the Group with its registered office in France, his/her performance shares will vest at the end of a two-year vesting period. Such performance shares will be available following the expiration of a two-year holding period. For a beneficiary who is an employee and/or Executive Officer of a company within the Group with its registered office outside of France, the vesting period is four years, with no additional holding period; </FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:21.3pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify>&#183;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial">Performance condition: Evaluation of the Group&#8217;s performance must be based on the same criteria as those used for the Global Annual Incentive Plan. For each of the criteria, quantified targets will be fixed at the start of each year for the current fiscal year. At the end of the two or four-year vesting periods, so long as the beneficiary has been an employee of the Group for two years (with limited exceptions) the number of performance shares that will vest will depend on the achievement, based on an average, of the annual Group performance targets set by our Board for the two or four-year periods.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=center>F34</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<HR style="padding-top:7.2pt; padding-bottom:7.2pt" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="page-break-before:always; margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><I><U>Conditions of settlement:</U></I></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>All performance shares granted by Alcatel-Lucent are exclusively settled in shares.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><I><U>Number of performance shares granted and changes in number of performance shares </U></I></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>

<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>

<P style="margin-top:2pt; margin-bottom:0pt; padding-left:14.2pt; text-indent:-14.15pt; line-height:10pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt" align=justify>(1) Of which for the six months ended June 30, 2009: a capital gain of &#8364; 255 million related to the disposal of Thales shares in May 2009.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:14.2pt; text-indent:-14.15pt; line-height:10pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt" align=justify>(2) Of which for the six months ended June 30, 2009: a gain of &#8364;&nbsp;50 million in Q1 2009 related to the partial repurchase of Lucent&#8217;s 7.75% bonds due March 2017 (see Note&nbsp;17) and in Q2 2009 a loss of &#8364;&nbsp;175 million related to change of estimated future cash flows related to Lucent&#8217;s 2.875 % Series A convertible debentures (see notes 15 and 17).</P>
<P style="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; padding-bottom:3pt; line-height:14pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:12pt; border-bottom:2.25pt solid #000000" align=justify><B>Note 7 Discontinued operations, assets held for sale and liabilities related to disposal groups held for sale</B></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Discontinued operations for the first six months of 2009 and 2008 are as follows:</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:21.3pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify>&#183;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial">for the first six months of 2009: adjustment of the selling price related to the disposal of the space business to Thales that was sold in 2007.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:21.3pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify>&#183;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial">In 2008: adjustments on initial capital gain (loss) on discontinued operations that were sold or contributed in previous periods.</FONT></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Other assets held for sale concern real estate property or businesses sales in progress at June 30,&nbsp;2009 and real estate property sales in progress at June 30,&nbsp;2008 and December 31, 2008.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>

</TD><TD style="border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=bottom width=13.267>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

</TD><TD style="border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=bottom width=139.867><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=right><B>2,259,120,685</B></P>
</TD><TD style="border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=bottom width=13.267>&nbsp;</TD></TR>

</TD><TD style="background-color:#ECECEC; border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=bottom width=146.333><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=right><B>2,259,674,960</B></P>
</TD><TD style="background-color:#ECECEC; border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=bottom width=139.867><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=right><B>2,259,087,469</B></P>
</TD><TD style="background-color:#ECECEC; border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=bottom width=13.267>&nbsp;</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:12.75pt; text-indent:-12.75pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><B>b/ Earnings per share calculation</B></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Basic earnings per share is computed using the number of shares issued, after deduction of the weighted average number of shares owned by consolidated subsidiaries and the weighting effect of shares issued during the year. </P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Diluted earnings per share takes into account share equivalents having a dilutive effect, after deducting the weighted average number of share equivalents owned by consolidated subsidiaries, but not share equivalents that do not have a dilutive effect. Net income (loss) is adjusted for after-tax interest expense relating to convertible bonds.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>The dilutive effects of stock option and stock purchase plans are calculated using the &quot;treasury stock method&quot;, which provides that proceeds to be received from the exercise of options or purchase of stock are assumed to be used first to purchase shares at market price. The dilutive effects of convertible bonds are calculated on the assumption that the bonds and notes will be systematically redeemed for shares (the &quot;if converted method&quot;).</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=center>F37</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<HR style="padding-top:7.2pt; padding-bottom:7.2pt" noshade size=1.333>

<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>The following table summarizes the number of potential ordinary shares that were excluded from the diluted per share calculation, because the effect of including theses potential shares was anti-dilutive:</P>

<P style="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; padding-bottom:3pt; line-height:14pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:12pt; border-bottom:2.25pt solid #000000" align=justify><B>Note 10 Impairment test of goodwill </B></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><B><I>Specific impairment test as of January 1, 2009 in connection with the new organization</I></B></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Due to the new organization of our reporting structure effective from January 1, 2009 onwards (see note 4), an additional impairment test was performed as of January 1, 2009 on the goodwill relating to the Business Divisions which changed. The remaining goodwill as of December 31, 2008 was reallocated to the new Business Divisions using a relative value approach similar to the one used when an entity disposes of an operation within a Business Division. No impairment loss was accounted for in connection with this impairment test.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><B><I>Annual impairment test of goodwill</I></B></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>The 2009 annual impairment tests of goodwill (performed in Q2 2009) did not result in any impairment loss.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=center>F38</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<HR style="padding-top:7.2pt; padding-bottom:7.2pt" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="page-break-before:always; margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>In those groups of cash generating units (&#147;CGU&#148; &#150; please refer to note 1g) in which there is significant goodwill, the data and assumptions used for the goodwill impairment tests were as follows: </P>

<P style="margin-top:2pt; margin-bottom:0pt; padding-left:14.2pt; text-indent:-14.2pt; line-height:10pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt" align=justify>(1) Of which &#8364; 77 million matures within one year as of June 30, 2009 (&#8364;&nbsp;301 million as of December 31, 2008).</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:14.2pt; line-height:10pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt" align=justify>Of which &#8364; 43 million of financial assets at amortized cost represented a loan to one of Alcatel-Lucent's joint ventures as of June 30,&nbsp;2009 (&#8364;&nbsp;42 million as of December&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2008).</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:14.2pt; text-indent:-14.2pt; line-height:10pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt" align=justify>(2) Of which &#8364;&nbsp;1,025 million is current as of June 30,&nbsp;2009 (&#8364; 906 million as of December 31, 2008).</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:14.2pt; text-indent:-14.2pt; line-height:10pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt" align=justify>(3) Of which a decrease of &#8364; 252 million (US$ 328 million), including &#8364; 223 million of reclassification against general risks reserves (see note 16), related to the restricted cash on the Winstar litigation that was settled during the first quarter of 2009, representing a net positive impact in our cash provided by operating activities of &#8364; 24 million.</P>

<P style="margin-top:2pt; margin-bottom:0pt; padding-left:14.2pt; text-indent:-14.2pt; line-height:10pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt" align=justify>(1)&nbsp;Following the definitive agreement announced as of December&nbsp;19,&nbsp;2008 to sell our stake in Thales to Dassault Aviation, our shares were reclassified at this date from net assets in equity affiliates to assets held for sale. Our stake was disposed of in May 2009.</P>

<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><B><I>Compound financial instruments issued by Lucent before the business combination</I></B></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>

<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>We re-assessed during the closing of the second quarter&#146;s financial results the reliability of the future estimated cash flows from Lucent&#146;s 2.875 % Series A convertible debentures. Based upon the remaining period until the next optional redemption date (i.e. June 15, 2010), the current and recent share price and other market data, we considered as a reliable estimate that bond holders will redeem the bonds on the optional redemption date. </P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=center>F42</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<HR style="padding-top:7.2pt; padding-bottom:7.2pt" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="page-break-before:always; margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Therefore, the estimated future cash flows associated to this convertible debenture were changed and the accounting presentation was amended in accordance with IAS 39 requirements. This change in estimates represented an &#8220;other financial loss&#8221; of US$ 233 million (&#8364;&nbsp;175 million-see Note 6) and a corresponding increase in the carrying value of this financial debt compared to December 31, 2008 (see Note 17).</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><I><U>7.75% Convertible Securities (Liability to Subsidiary Trust Issuing Preferred Securities)</U></I></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Lucent may redeem the debentures, in whole or in part, for cash at premiums ranging from 103.88% beginning March&nbsp;20,&nbsp;2007, to 100.00% on March&nbsp;20,&nbsp;2012 and thereafter. To the extent Lucent redeems debentures, the Trust is required to redeem a corresponding amount of trust preferred securities. Lucent has irrevocably and unconditionally guaranteed, on a subordinated basis, the payments due on the trust preferred securities to the extent Lucent makes payments on the debentures to the Trust.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<TABLE style="font-size:10pt" cellspacing=0><TR><TD valign=bottom width=324><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Conversion ratio </P>
</TD><TD valign=bottom width=306><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>40.3306</P>
</TD></TR>
<TR><TD valign=bottom width=324><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Conversion price</P>
</TD><TD valign=bottom width=306><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>$24.80</P>
</TD></TR>
<TR><TD valign=bottom width=324><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Redemption period at Lucent&#146;s option</P>

<P style="margin-top:2pt; margin-bottom:0pt; padding-left:14.2pt; text-indent:-14.15pt; line-height:10pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt" align=justify>(1) Excluding provisions for product sales on construction contracts which are accounted for in amounts due to/from customers on construction contracts (see note 13).</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:14.2pt; text-indent:-14.15pt; line-height:10pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt" align=justify>(2) &#8364;&nbsp;1 million for interest accrued, a reversal for the difference between the initially estimated amount of the risk and the definitive amount of &#8364;&nbsp;15 million and a reclassification against restricted cash for an amount of &#8364;&nbsp;223 million (see note 11) due to the settlement of the Winstar litigation that occurred during the first quarter of 2009 (see note 21).</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:14.2pt; text-indent:-14.15pt; line-height:10pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt" align=justify>(3) Accounted for on a specific line item &quot;Post-retirement benefit plan amendments&quot; in the income statement. The &#8364;&nbsp;1&nbsp;million as of June 30,&nbsp;2009 was reserved for the litigation disclosed in note 21 (Lucent's employment and benefits related cases) that concerns a previous healthcare plan amendment.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>At period-end, contingent liabilities exist with regards to ongoing tax disputes and outstanding investigation related to the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (FCPA) as disclosed in Note 21h. Neither the financial impact nor the timing of any cash payment that could result from an unfavorable outcome for certain of these disputes can be estimated at present and therefore nothing has been reserved as of June 30, 2009.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>

<P style="margin-top:2pt; margin-bottom:0pt; padding-left:14.2pt; text-indent:-14.2pt; line-height:10pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt" align=justify>(1) For the first six months of 2009, total restructuring costs were &#8364;&nbsp;201 million, representing &#8364;&nbsp;45 million of costs, valuation allowances or write-offs of assets of &#8364;&nbsp;43 million and &#8364;&nbsp;113 million for new restructuring plans and adjustments to previous plans. In addition, a finance cost of &#8364;&nbsp;3 million, related to the reversal of the discount element included in provisions, was recorded in other financial income (loss).</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:14.2pt; line-height:10pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt" align=justify>For 2008, total restructuring costs were &#8364;&nbsp;562 million, representing &#8364;&nbsp;38 million of costs, valuation allowance on assets of &#8364;&nbsp;35 million and &#8364;&nbsp;489 million for new restructuring plans and adjustments to previous plans. In addition, a finance cost of &#8364; 6 million, related to the reversal of the discount element included in certain restructuring provisions, was recorded in other financial income (loss).</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>New restructuring plans were announced in July 2009 in various European countries. In accordance with IAS 37 requirements, no reserve related to these new plans was accounted for as of June 30, 2009. The corresponding reserves will be accounted for when the IAS 37 provision recognition criteria apply.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>

<P style="margin-top:2pt; margin-bottom:0pt; padding-left:14.2pt; text-indent:-14.2pt; line-height:10pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt" align=justify>(1) Benefit from a full and unconditional subordinated guaranty from Lucent Technologies Inc (now known as Alcatel-Lucent USA Inc.).</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:14.2pt; text-indent:-14.2pt; line-height:10pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt" align=justify>(2) See note 15 for details on Put and Call options.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:14.2pt; text-indent:-14.2pt; line-height:10pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt" align=justify>(3) Benefit from a full and unconditional subordinated guaranty from Alcatel-Lucent.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:14.2pt; text-indent:-14.2pt; line-height:10pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt" align=justify>(4) Due to the change of estimated cash flows related to the 2.875 % Series A debentures, the carrying value of this bond was increased by US$ 233 million with a corresponding &#147;other financial loss&#148; as disclosed in Note 6. Refer to additional comments in Notes 2-j and 15.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:14.2pt; text-indent:-14.2pt; line-height:10pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt" align=justify>(5) Face amounts outstanding as at June 30,&nbsp;2009.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR>

<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=center>F45</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<HR style="padding-top:7.2pt; padding-bottom:7.2pt" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="page-break-before:always; margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><I><U>Changes during the six month period ended June 30, 2009:</U></I></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:21.3pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify>&#183;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial"><I>Repurchases</I> (redemption before maturity date):</FONT></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Lucent convertible bond 7.75% US$ due March 2017 was subject to partial buy-back and cancellation in the first quarter of 2009, using US$&nbsp;28&nbsp;million in cash , corresponding to a nominal value of US$&nbsp;99 million.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><I>Nominal value repurchased&nbsp;: </I></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Lucent convertible bond 7.75% US$ due March 2017:</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; text-indent:267.9pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>US$&nbsp;99,000,000</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>The consideration paid in connection with an early redemption of a convertible bond is allocated at the date of redemption between the liability and the equity components with an allocation method consistent with the method used initially. The amount of gain or loss relating to the liability component is recognized in &#147;other financial income (loss)&#148; and the amount of consideration relating to the equity component is recognized in equity.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>A gain of &#8364; 50 million related to these repurchases was recorded in other financial income (loss) in the first quarter of 2009 (see Note 6).</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><U><BR></U></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:21.3pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify>&#183;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial">Repayments</FONT></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Alcatel-Lucent&#8217;s 4.375% EUR bond due February 2009 was repaid in February 2009 for a nominal value of &#8364;&nbsp;777 million.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><U><BR></U></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><I><U>Changes in 2008:</U></I></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:21.3pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify>&#183;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial"><I>Repurchases</I> (redemption before maturity date):</FONT></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Certain bonds were subject to buy-back and cancellation in 2008, using &#8364;&nbsp;27 million and US$&nbsp;23&nbsp;million in cash, corresponding to a nominal value of &#8364;&nbsp;28 million and US$&nbsp;72 million, detailed as follows: </P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><B><BR></B></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><I>Nominal value repurchased&nbsp;: </I></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Lucent convertible bond 7.75% US$ due March 2017:</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; text-indent:267.9pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>US$&nbsp;72,229,000</P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Alcatel-Lucent 4.375% EUR bond due February 2009:</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; text-indent:279.65pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>&#8364;&nbsp;27,801,000</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>The consideration paid in connection with an early redemption of a convertible bond is allocated at the date of redemption between the liability and the equity components with an allocation method consistent with the method used initially. The amount of gain or loss relating to the liability component is recognized in &#147;other financial income (loss)&#148; and the amount of consideration relating to the equity component is recognized in equity.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>For straight bonds, the difference between the repurchased amount and the nominal value is included in financial income (loss) in other financial income (loss), net.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>The gains related to these repurchases were respectively &#8364;&nbsp;1 million and &#8364;&nbsp;30 million for the Alcatel-Lucent 4.375% bond and the Lucent 7.75% bond representing a total gain of &#8364;&nbsp;31 million in &#8220;other financial income (loss)&#8221;, net (see Note 6).</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><U><BR></U></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:21.3pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify>&#183;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial">&nbsp;Repayments</FONT></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Lucent's 5.50% US$ bond was repaid in November 2008 for a nominal value of &#8364;&nbsp;137 million.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=center>F46</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>

</TD></TR>
<TR><TD style="border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=bottom width=405.467 colspan=2><P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><B>Financial debt due within one year </B>(1)</P>

</TD><TD style="background-color:#DFDFDF; border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=top width=126.933><P style="margin:0pt; padding-right:3.95pt; font-family:Arial" align=right><B>4,286</B></P>
</TD><TD style="background-color:#DFDFDF; border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=top width=1.333>&nbsp;</TD><TD style="background-color:#DFDFDF; border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=top width=147.4 colspan=2><P style="margin:0pt; padding-right:6.4pt; font-family:Arial" align=right><B>5,095</B></P>
</TD></TR>
</TABLE>
<P style="margin-top:2pt; margin-bottom:0pt; padding-left:14.2pt; text-indent:-14.2pt; line-height:10pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt" align=justify>(1) Of which &#8364; 512 million related to the 2023 Lucent 2.875 % Series A convertible debentures, due to the existence of a put option exercisable as of June 15, 2010 (&#8364; 345 million as of December 31, 2008). </P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:14.2pt; text-indent:-14.2pt; line-height:10pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt" align=justify>(2) Of which &#8364; 1,016 million related to the Oceane 4.75 % due January 2011, as of June 30, 2009 (&#8364; 1,002 million as of December 31, 2008).</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:14.2pt; text-indent:-14.2pt; line-height:10pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt" align=justify>(3) The convertible securities may be retired earlier based on early redemption or buy back options. See note 15. In case of optional redemption periods/dates occurring before the contractual maturity of the debenture, the likelihood of the redemption before the contractual maturity could lead to a change in the estimated payments. As prescribed by IAS 39, if an entity revises the estimates of payment, due to reliable new estimates, it shall adjust the carrying amount of the instrument by computing the present value of remaining cash flows at the original effective interest rate of the financial liability to reflect the revised estimated cash flows. The adjustment is recognized as income or expense in profit or loss.</P>
<P style="margin-top:2pt; margin-bottom:0pt; padding-left:21.25pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><B><I>Breakdown of the debt by type of rate</I></B></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><B><BR></B></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Financial debt at fixed rate after hedging is approximately 90% of the total gross debt as of June 30, 2009, compared to 56% at the end of 2008.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>

<P style="margin-top:2pt; margin-bottom:0pt; line-height:10pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt" align=justify>(1) Except for preferred notes and bonds that continue to be rated (last update February&nbsp;18,&nbsp;2009).</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:14.2pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><I><U>Moody's</U></I>: on February 18, 2009, Moody&#146;s lowered the Alcatel-Lucent Corporate Family Rating, as well as the rating for senior debt of the Group, from Ba3 to B1. The trust preferred notes of Lucent Technologies Capital Trust were downgraded from B2 to B3. The Not-Prime rating for the short-term debt was confirmed. The negative outlook of the ratings was maintained.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>On April&nbsp;3,&nbsp;2008, Moody&#146;s had affirmed the Alcatel-Lucent Corporate Family Rating as well as that of the debt instruments originally issued by historical Alcatel and Lucent. The outlook was changed from stable to negative.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>The rating grid of Moody&#146;s ranges from AAA to C, which is the lowest rated class. Our B1 rating is in the B category, which also includes B2 and B3 ratings. Moody&#146;s gives the following definition of its B1 category: &#147;obligations rated B are considered speculative and are subject to high credit risk.&#148;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=center>F47</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<HR style="padding-top:7.2pt; padding-bottom:7.2pt" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="page-break-before:always; margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><I><U>Standard &amp; Poor's</U></I>: on March 3, 2009, Standard &amp; Poor&#146;s lowered to B+ from BB- its long-term corporate credit ratings and senior unsecured ratings on Alcatel-Lucent and on Lucent. The ratings on the trust preferred notes of Lucent Technologies Capital Trust were lowered to CCC+. The B short-term rating on Alcatel-Lucent was affirmed. The B 1 rating on Lucent was withdrawn. The outlook is negative.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>On December 12, 2008, Standard &amp; Poor&#146;s placed on Credit Watch with negative implications the long-term corporate credit ratings of Alcatel-Lucent and Lucent, as well as all issue ratings on both companies. At the same time, the long-term credit ratings were affirmed.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>On July&nbsp;31,&nbsp;2008, Standard &amp; Poor&#146;s revised to negative from stable its outlook on Alcatel-Lucent and Lucent long-term corporate credit ratings. At the same time the long and short-term debt ratings of Alcatel-Lucent and of Lucent were affirmed.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial">On March 19, 2008, the remainder of Lucent&#146;s senior unsecured debt was raised to BB-. The trust preferred notes of Lucent Technologies Capital Trust were rated B-. </P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial"><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>The rating grid of Standard &amp; Poor&#146;s ranges from AAA (the strongest rating) to D (the weakest rating). Our B+ rating is in the B category, which also includes B+ and B- ratings. Standard &amp; Poor&#146;s gives the following definition to the B category: &#147;An obligation rated &#147;B&#148; is more vulnerable to non-payment than obligations rated &#147;BB&#148; but the obligor currently has the capacity to meet its financial commitment on the obligation. Adverse business, financial or economic condition likely will impair the obligator&#146;s capacity or willingness to meet its financial commitment on the obligation.&#148;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><I><U>Rating clauses affecting Alcatel-Lucent and Lucent debt at June 30,&nbsp;2009</U></I></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Alcatel-Lucent&#146;s short-term debt rating allows a limited access to the French commercial paper market for short periods of time.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Alcatel-Lucent's and Lucent&#146;s outstanding bonds do not contain clauses that could trigger an accelerated repayment in the event of a lowering of their respective credit ratings. </P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:12.75pt; text-indent:-12.75pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><B>d/ Bank credit agreements</B></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><B><I>Alcatel-Lucent syndicated bank credit facility </I></B></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>On April&nbsp;5,&nbsp;2007, Alcatel-Lucent obtained a &#8364;&nbsp;1.4 billion multi-currency syndicated five-year revolving bank credit facility (with two one-year extension options). On March&nbsp;21,&nbsp;2008, &#8364;&nbsp;837 million of availability under the facility was extended until April&nbsp;5,&nbsp;2013.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>The availability of this syndicated credit facility of &#8364;&nbsp;1.4 billion is not dependent upon Alcatel-Lucent&#8217;s credit ratings. Alcatel-Lucent&#8217;s ability to draw on this facility is conditioned upon its compliance with a financial covenant linked to the capacity of Alcatel-Lucent to generate sufficient cash to repay its net debt and compliance is tested quarterly when we release our consolidated financial statements. Since the &#8364;&nbsp;1.4 billion facility was established, Alcatel has complied every quarter with the financial covenant that is included in the facility. The facility was undrawn at the date of approval by Alcatel-Lucent&#146;s Board of Directors of the financial statements for the six months ended June 30, 2009.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:12.75pt; text-indent:-12.75pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><B>e/ Liquidity risk on the financial debt </B></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>The Group considers that its available cash, cash equivalents and marketable securities, and the available syndicated bank credit facility (refer to Note 17d) are sufficient to cover its operating expenses and capital expenditures and its debt requirements for the next twelve months.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>See note 20 Contractual obligations and disclosures related to off balance sheet commitments.</P>
<P style="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; padding-bottom:3pt; line-height:14pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:12pt; border-bottom:2.25pt solid #000000" align=justify><B>Note 18 Pensions, retirement indemnities and other post-retirement benefits</B></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Alcatel-Lucent has elected to apply the option offered by the amendment of IAS 19 (see note 1k) which allows for immediate recognition in the statement of comprehensive income of actuarial gains and losses as well as any adjustments resulting from asset ceiling limits.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>97% of Alcatel-Lucent's total benefit obligations and 98% of Alcatel-Lucent's plan asset fair values were remeasured as of June 30,&nbsp;2009. Alcatel-Lucent&#146;s pension and post-retirement obligations in the United States and Alcatel-Lucent&#146;s main pension plans outside of the U.S. (in France, Germany, United Kingdom, the Netherlands and Belgium) have been remeasured. The impact of not remeasuring other pension and post-retirement obligations is considered not material.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=center>F48</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<HR style="padding-top:7.2pt; padding-bottom:7.2pt" noshade size=1.333>
<P style="page-break-before:always; margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>For Alcatel-Lucent&#146;s pension and post-retirement obligations in the United States, the impacts considered were decreases in interest rates and differences between actual and expected plan asset performance and benefit payments. Actuarial losses of &#8364; (493) million (of which &#8364; (492) million related to pensions and &#8364; (1) million related to post-retirement benefits) resulted from lower actual plan asset returns than expected and actuarial losses of &#8364; (376) million (of which &#8364; (350) million related to pensions and &#8364; (26) million related to post-retirement benefits) resulted from an increase of plan obligations mainly due to discount rate decreases.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>For Alcatel-Lucent&#146;s main pension plans outside of the U.S., the impacts were estimated based on a sensitivity analysis that considered changes in interest rates and differences between actual and expected plan asset performance. Actuarial gains of &#8364; 50 million resulted from higher actual plan asset returns than expected. No actuarial gains or losses arose from plan obligations. The impacts from all other pension and post-retirement plans were not significant.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Discount rates used to measure Alcatel-Lucent&#146;s pension and post-retirement obligations in the United States and Alcatel-Lucent&#146;s main pension plans outside of the U.S. as of June 30,&nbsp;2009 have been updated and are as follows:</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>

<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>The change in the unrecognized surplus of plan assets (asset ceiling) and in the IFRIC14 effect during the six months ended June 30,&nbsp;2009 was &#8364;&nbsp;462 million and related only to pensions (&#8364;&nbsp;(203) million at June 30,&nbsp;2008).</P>

</TD><TD style="border-bottom:0.5pt solid #000000" valign=bottom width=60.2><P style="margin:0pt; line-height:11pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:9pt" align=right><B>19</B></P>

<P style="margin-top:2pt; margin-bottom:0pt; padding-left:14.2pt; text-indent:-14.15pt; line-height:10pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt" align=justify>(1) This income is due to the expected return on plan assets in excess of the interest cost.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:14.2pt; text-indent:-14.15pt; line-height:10pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt" align=justify>(2) Accounted for in restructuring costs.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:14.2pt; text-indent:-14.15pt; line-height:10pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt" align=justify>(3) Accounted for on a specific line item &#147;Post-retirement benefit plan amendments&#148; in the income statement.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:14.2pt; text-indent:-14.15pt; line-height:10pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt" align=justify>(4) The amounts recognized directly in the Statement of comprehensive income indicated in the table above differ from the one disclosed in the Statement of comprehensive income on page 5, due to the amounts related to discontinued activities, which are excluded in the above table.</P>

<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><B><I>2008 U.S. management healthcare plan amendment</I></B></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>On July&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2008, certain changes to Lucent&#146;s management retiree healthcare benefits were approved by the board of Directors of Lucent Technologies Inc (now known as Alcatel-Lucent USA Inc.) and announced to retirees between August and the beginning of October. Effective January&nbsp;1,&nbsp;2009, post-retirement medical benefits for Medicare eligible management participants are provided through a fully insured Medicare Advantage Private Fee-For-Service (PFFS) Plan. Under this plan, the PFFS plan contracts directly with the Centers for Medicare &amp; Medicaid Services to provide all Medicare Parts A and B benefits for Medicare eligible management retirees. These changes imply a &#8364;&nbsp;148 million benefit obligation decrease for the management retiree healthcare plan. &#8364;&nbsp;83 million of this decrease, which related to management employees who retired before March&nbsp;1,&nbsp;1990, was considered as a change of actuarial assum
ptions and was recognized in the statement of comprehensive income. &#8364;&nbsp;65 million of this decrease, which related to management employees who retired on or after March&nbsp;1,&nbsp;1990 and who are subject to defined caps, was considered as a plan amendment and was recognized in the 2008 income statement in the specific line item &quot;Post-retirement benefit plan amendments&quot;.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=center>F50</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>

<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>In addition to the &#8364;&nbsp;65 million income recognized in the specific line item &#8220;Post-retirement benefit plan amendments&#8221;, an &#8364;&nbsp;18 million expense related to the Raetsch case disclosed in note 21 was recognized in 2008, representing a net income of &#8364;&nbsp;47 million. In the first six months of 2009, a &#8364;&nbsp;2 million additional expense was recognized in the specific line item &#8220;Post-retirement benefit plan amendments&#8221; concerning the Raetsch case.</P>

<P style="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; padding-bottom:3pt; line-height:14pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:12pt; border-bottom:2.25pt solid #000000" align=justify><B>Note 20 Off balance sheet commitments</B></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:12.75pt; text-indent:-12.75pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><B>a/ Contractual obligations</B></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>The following table presents minimum payments the Group will have to make in the future under contracts and firm commitments as of June 30, 2009. Amounts related to financial debt and capital lease obligations are fully reflected in the consolidated statement of financial position.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>

<P style="margin-top:2pt; margin-bottom:0pt; padding-left:14.2pt; text-indent:-14.2pt; line-height:10pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt" align=justify>(1) To compute finance costs on financial debt, all put dates have been considered as redemption dates. For debentures with calls but no puts, call dates have not been considered as redemption dates. Further details on put and call dates are given in Note 15. If all outstanding debentures were not redeemed at their respective put dates, we would incur an additional finance cost of approximately &#8364;&nbsp;408 million until redemption at their respective contractual maturities (of which &#8364;&nbsp;24 million in 2010-2011 and the remaining part in 2012 or later).</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:14.2pt; text-indent:-14.2pt; line-height:10pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt" align=justify>(2) Other firm commitments result mainly from purchase obligations related to multi-year equipment supply contracts linked to the sale of businesses to third parties.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:14.2pt; text-indent:-14.2pt; line-height:10pt; font-family:Arial; font-size:8pt" align=justify>(3) Obligations related to pensions, post-retirement health and welfare benefits and postemployment benefit obligations are excluded from the table. Refer to Note 18.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:12.75pt; text-indent:-12.75pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><B>b/ Off balance sheet commitments</B></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Off balance sheet commitments of the Group were primarily as follows:</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:21.3pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify>&#183;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial">certain guarantees given to the Group&#8217;s customers for contract execution (performance bonds and guarantees on advances received that were issued by Alcatel-Lucent to financial institutions);</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:21.3pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify>&#183;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial">guarantee relating to the maximum intra-day bank overdraft allowed for Group subsidiaries under the Group&#8217;s cash pooling agreement with certain banks;</FONT></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:-12pt; padding-left:21.3pt; text-indent:-18pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify>&#183;</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; padding-left:21.3pt; font-family:Symbol" align=justify><FONT FACE="Arial">guarantees given under securitization programs or on sale of receivables (see description below).</FONT></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>Alcatel-Lucent does not rely on special purpose entities to deconsolidate these risks. </P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR></P>
<P style="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:10pt; text-indent:36pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify>With respect to guarantees given for contract performance, only those issued by the Group to back guarantees granted by financial institutions are presented in the table below.</P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=justify><BR>
<BR></P>
<P style="margin:0pt; font-family:Arial" align=center>F52</P>
